title: Ticket #2801: Symlink attack possible in condor_glexec_kill
description:
Hi,

It's not a particularly interesting symlink attack, but the first line of condor_glexec_kill is:

echo $0 "$@" > /tmp/glkout

That would allow any unprivileged attacker to overwrite any arbitrary file belonging to the pilot. Again, I don't think this is a very interesting attack, but maybe someone else out there is very clever.

This appears to be debug code that never got scrubbed. Commit is from 2008, so it's been around for awhile.

A quick grep through the code reveals other usage of /tmp, but the other random callsites I selected appear to be protected by safefile_open. It'd be really nice to collect all the usage of /tmp into a single location so we can easily audit for safety.

Brian
remarks:

agree it's not a very interesting attack, but fixed nonetheless.
